snippet.textDisplay:
Nothing of the sort happens in Persona 4, Chie is still a bitch, Yukiko is still boring, Naoto is still underdeveloped, Rise is still kind of whory, Yosuke is still a whining prick...
Kanji is the only one who grows as a character, at least in his social link.
snippet.textOriginal:
Nothing of the sort happens in Persona 4, Chie is still a bitch, Yukiko is still boring, Naoto is still underdeveloped, Rise is still kind of whory, Yosuke is still a whining prick...
Kanji is the only one who grows as a character, at least in his social link.

snippet.textDisplay:
Sure, let's just forget how Aigis starts as a total toaster and ends up being more human than the rest of the cast, or how Mituru slowly starts trusting everyone and growing along with them, or how about Junpei is a happy dude to end up a brave and determined man, or how Akihiko doesn't give a shit about anything but fighting and training only to end up fighting in memory of his recently killed friend and finally starting to feel apathy towards others?

Sure, let's all forget that shit happened.
snippet.textOriginal:
Sure, let's just forget how Aigis starts as a total toaster and ends up being more human than the rest of the cast, or how Mituru slowly starts trusting everyone and growing along with them, or how about Junpei is a happy dude to end up a brave and determined man, or how Akihiko doesn't give a shit about anything but fighting and training only to end up fighting in memory of his recently killed friend and finally starting to feel apathy towards others?

Sure, let's all forget that shit happened.

snippet.textDisplay: 3 was the one with no character development.
snippet.textOriginal: 3 was the one with no character development.

snippet.textDisplay: Watch out for the wall of text above.
snippet.textOriginal: Watch out for the wall of text above.

snippet.textDisplay:
4's plot was almost non-existant, neither of the characters are developed further than explaining their problems (or bitchy complaints, in case of Yukiko), the music score was ok, but the final boss fight (Izanami) had the most forgetable, dull and boring soundtrack I've ever heard on a game ever.
The reason they could enter the TV was because Izanami wanted them to because reasons, and the only good character was Kanji.
The MC has less personality than 3's and that's a lot to say, his name "broswagonist" comes from the anime, where he actually does shit.
And now, small details that ruined the game:
-The final boss was a gas station attendant
-The final boss was a secret boss
-The progression was fucked, some bosses were nearly impossible without a couple of hours of grinding while otheres were LVL 1 Rats from any RPG
-Chie, the best girl, was a bitch
-The only time the game was interesting was more than 15 hours in (when Morooka dies)
-The only time the game was interesting ends way too soon
-Nanako is annoying, more than Morgana from P5
-Literally nothing bad happens or threatens to happen, so there's no tension until endgame
-Money was nearly nonexistant, SP recovery items as well
-The city was lifeless, small and ironically felt like a chore to travel between places

Persona 5 was a completely different thing, it did a straight 96 hours first run for me while developing characters (except of course for Haru, who I didn't like at all) left and right with way more interesting S.Links than P4.
The soundtrack was godly, and Shoji's Meguro best score yet.
Palaces were handcrafted and they had puzzles within, adding life to the dungeons P3 and P4 didn't have.
The main theme of the game was Rebellion and Freedom, and it exposed it outstandingly without ramming it up your eyes ("Reach out to the truth" makes a direct reference to P4's main theme, along with countless dialogs in game, treating the player like an idiotic child).
Now, good shit and bad shit about the game:
-The final boss was meh, but it had a great soundtrack for it and was legitimately somewhat of a challenge
-The cities were gorgeus with tons of stuff to do, and a fast travel menu that didn't make me feel frustrated despite the cities' size
-Beneath the Mask
-Akechi was a really obvious traitor, but his fight was hype as shit
-Shido's fight is one of the best in the series
-The progression was managed from start to finish, so no one had to grind (the game reached 100~ hours despite this)
-The bosses had unique mechanics to them, making them even more memorable
-Profficiency's easter eggs
-Gameplay was fun, battle system was addictive as shit and the interface gave me eyegasms several times

So the graphics were the only thing going for P5?
Here's a TLDR from someone who's actually played 4 Persona games and is currently playing P2:
-P5 has best gameplay
-P3 has best plot
-P2 has best main characters
-P3 has best side characters
-P5 has best interface and graphic design
-P5 has best soundtrack
-P5 has best bosses
-P5 has best dungeons
-P5 has best battle system
-P5 has best progression
-P3 has best final boss
-P5 has best city / cities
-P5 has best MC (Akira)
-P2 has best side character (any of them, really)
-P5 has best supporting cast (S.Links / Confidants)

Also, P3's S.Links were people who were familiar with death, P5's Confidants were people who had been incorrectly judged by society, while P4's S.Links are just people and that's it.

snippet.textDisplay:
I seem to remember it being called that due to the title referencing the fog throughout the game, which is -always- called Fog, not Mist.  But I don't have Side B to be able to confirm english OST name.

And I went back and fact-checked myself.

Good End, Final Boss 1: A New World Fool
Good End Final Boss 2: The Almighty
True End Final Phase 1: Fog/Mist
True End Final Phase 2: The Genesis

I forgot how many (Awesome) battle themes were in this game @_@
snippet.textOriginal:
I seem to remember it being called that due to the title referencing the fog throughout the game, which is -always- called Fog, not Mist.  But I don't have Side B to be able to confirm english OST name.

And I went back and fact-checked myself.

Good End, Final Boss 1: A New World Fool
Good End Final Boss 2: The Almighty
True End Final Phase 1: Fog/Mist
True End Final Phase 2: The Genesis

I forgot how many (Awesome) battle themes were in this game @_@

snippet.textDisplay:
The official OST has this song named "Mist". I did some research and I'm not sure where the "Fog" name comes from. I did put it in the description as an alternate title though since some people refer to it as that.

As for Final Boss, then I guess it's my mistake! I searched on youtube and this song was playing while fighting what the uploader called "The True Final Boss".
snippet.textOriginal:
The official OST has this song named "Mist". I did some research and I'm not sure where the "Fog" name comes from. I did put it in the description as an alternate title though since some people refer to it as that.

As for Final Boss, then I guess it's my mistake! I searched on youtube and this song was playing while fighting what the uploader called "The True Final Boss".

snippet.textDisplay: "Mist" is the literal translation of the original Japanese title of the name. "The Fog" is what the song is called in the official English OST release, and is generally preferred over Mist as it makes much more sense within the context of the game (the English version at least, anyways).
snippet.textOriginal: "Mist" is the literal translation of the original Japanese title of the name. "The Fog" is what the song is called in the official English OST release, and is generally preferred over Mist as it makes much more sense within the context of the game (the English version at least, anyways).

snippet.textDisplay:
I'm pretty sure the official name is "Fog", not mist.

Nor is this the theme of the final boss (Unless you're not doing the True End dungeon)

This song is still AWESOME though.
snippet.textOriginal:
I'm pretty sure the official name is "Fog", not mist.

Nor is this the theme of the final boss (Unless you're not doing the True End dungeon)

snippet.textDisplay: It's a kickass theme though I enjoy the Almighty more.
snippet.textOriginal: It's a kickass theme though I enjoy the Almighty more.
